delta.title: Delta Ecografía
delta.intro: Designing and developing the web application for Delta Ecografía, a prominent gynecologist center in Madrid specializing in 3D/4D ecography, using React.js

description.subtitle: Efficient Development Workflow
content: Leveraging Vite as the build tool ensures rapid development and optimized build times. This allows for quick iteration and testing, speeding up the development process.

description.subtitle: Modern UI Components
content: Utilizing React Bootstrap along with Bootstrap's comprehensive UI toolkit, your app offers sleek, responsive, and pre-styled components. This not only accelerates development but also ensures a consistent and visually appealing user interface across various devices and screen sizes.

description.subtitle: Enhanced User Experience
content: By incorporating React Spring for smooth animations and transitions, as well as Swiper for touch-enabled sliders and carousels, your app delivers an engaging and interactive user experience. These features elevate the visual appeal and usability of the app, keeping users engaged and immersed in the content.

description.subtitle: Intuitive Navigation:
content: With React Router facilitating client-side routing, users can navigate seamlessly between different views and pages within the app. This ensures a fluid and intuitive browsing experience, enhancing user satisfaction and retention.

description.subtitle: Cloudinary for Media Management
content: Integrating Cloudinary provides a robust solution for managing media assets such as images and videos. By offloading storage, optimization, and delivery tasks to Cloudinary's platform, your app benefits from improved performance, reduced bandwidth usage, and seamless media handling across various devices and resolutions.

description.subtitle: Deployment with Netlify
content: Utilizing Netlify for deployment simplifies the process of deploying and hosting your app in the cloud. With features like continuous deployment, automatic builds, and serverless functions, Netlify streamlines the deployment pipeline, allowing you to focus on building and refining your application. Additionally, Netlify's global CDN ensures fast and reliable content delivery to users worldwide, enhancing the overall user experience.

mamachama.title: Mamachama
mamachama.intro: Designing and developing the web application for Mamachama Association using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js)

description.subtitle: Secure Authentication
content: I implemented a robust authentication system using JSON Web Tokens (JWT), ensuring the security of the association members' accounts. From user registration to login and session management, each step was crafted with a focus on security and usability

description.subtitle: User Registration and Credential Management
content: The user registration process was streamlined while maintaining data integrity with real-time validation. Furthermore, advanced hashing and salting techniques were employed to securely store credentials, safeguarding our users' sensitive information.

description.subtitle: Responsive Experience
content: Every screen, from the login form to the project control panel, was designed with the user experience across various devices in mind. Thanks to the implementation of responsive CSS and frameworks like Bootstrap, the platform is accessible from anywhere, at any time.

description.subtitle: Simplified Project Uploads
content: I facilitated project uploads for association members with an intuitive and user-friendly form. From project descriptions to attachment uploads, each step was optimized to ensure a seamless and efficient experience.

description.subtitle: Efficient Deployment and Resource Management
content: For server deployment, I opted for efficiency and scalability using the Fly.io platform, which provides a fast and secure execution environment for our applications. Additionally, for the client side, I chose Netlify for its continuous deployment capability and high-performance hosting of static sites.

description.subtitle: Robust Database and Media Storage
content: The database is hosted on MongoDB Atlas, ensuring the robustness and scalability of our data. As for image and other multimedia storage, we rely on Cloudinary, a powerful platform that enables us to manage and optimize our visual resources efficiently.

devopsBootcamp.title: DevOps Bootcamp
devopsBootcamp.intro: This is the final project I leaded as a Scrum Master for Ironhack's DevOps Bootcamp. I developed it along with 3 other classmates and it focuses on implementing DevOps practices and deploying a web application using various tools and services.

description.subtitle: Part 1: Deploy Code Locally
content: We laid the groundwork by deploying our code locally. Simple as that.

description.subtitle: Part 2: Docker
content: We containerized the app for flexibility and scalability.

description.subtitle: Part 3: Docker-Compose
content: Making life easier with Docker-Compose while orchestrating multiple containers effortlessly.

description.subtitle: Part 4: Azure Web Apps
content: Jumping to the cloud: we explored Azure Web Apps and Azure Devops' pipelines for a smooth deployment experience.

description.subtitle: Part 5: AKS Cluster using Terraform
content: We used Terraform to create an AKS cluster managing state in Azure BLob Storage.

description.subtitle: Part 6: AKS deployment
content: This part took us to the cloud summit. With our AKS cluster ready, we deployed the whole application, leveraging Kubernetes.

description.subtitle: Part 7: Prometheus and Grafana
content: Using Ansible playbooks to deploy and manage Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring and visualization of virtual machines and AKS cluster.

helenadev.title: Porfolio
helenadev.intro: Here's a more technical approach of this site you're navigating!

description.subtitle: Frontend
content: In this React.js project, I developed a dynamic and responsive user interface to create an engaging user experience. Leveraging the React library, I organized the UI into modular components, fostering code maintainability and reusability. React Router facilitated seamless navigation between different pages, ensuring a smooth and user-friendly browsing experience.

To manage data interactions with the server, I implemented services that utilized the Axios library. Axios allowed for efficient handling of HTTP requests, enabling the application to communicate with the back-end for data retrieval and submission.

One standout feature is the implementation of an interactive hero section, creatively engaging users with a dynamic canvas. The hero section spans the entire height of the window and employs the HTML <canvas> tag to provide an immersive and visually appealing experience.

description.subtitle: Deployment and Version Control
content: Git was employed as the version control system, offering a collaborative platform to track code changes and manage development. The project's deployment was facilitated through Netlify, a hosting and deployment platform known for its user-friendly interface and seamless integration with Git. Netlify streamlined the deployment of the front-end, leveraging file-based routing and Git integration.

Although this project primarily focuses on the front-end, it successfully incorporates industry-standard practices for development, version control, and deployment, contributing to a robust and efficient application.

elMegafono.title: El Megáfono
elMegafono.intro: El Megáfono was my final fullstack MERN project for Ironhack's webDev bootcamp: A professional networking platform where individuals connect, showcase their work experiences, and interact with their potential employers: organizations from the third social sector.

description.subtitle: Back-end
content: In the back-end of El Megáfono application, I built a RESTful API using Node.js and the Express.js framework. I used Express.js to define the API routes and handle incoming HTTP requests. I connected the API to a MongoDB database, utilizing the MongoDB module for Node.js (mongoose), which allowed me to efficiently store and retrieve data.

I designed and created data models using Mongoose, defining the structure and relationships between data. This enabled me to store relevant information, such as posts, users, and categories, and access it consistently and structured.

I implemented authentication and authorization using JSON Web Tokens (JWT). When authenticating users, I generated a JWT token sent to the client and used for subsequent request authentication. This allowed me to protect API routes and resources, ensuring that only authenticated users had access to certain functionalities.

description.subtitle: Front-end
content: In the front-end of El Megáfono application, I used React.js as the JavaScript library to build an interactive and responsive user interface. I divided the user interface into reusable components, enabling me to maintain clean and modular code. I used React Router for application routing, allowing routes definition and smooth navigation between different pages.
I implemented services to handle data read and write operations. I used the Axios library to make HTTP requests to the back-end and efficiently retrieve and send data.

In addition to the technologies mentioned above, I used other tools to enhance the application's functionality and user experience. For example, I used Cloudinary for image storage and manipulation, enabling me to upload and display images efficiently on the platform.

description.subtitle: Deployment and more
content: I used Git as the version control system to collaborate on development and track code changes. Then, I used the deployment platforms Netlify and Fly to deploy the application. Netlify provided straightforward hosting and deployment for the front-end, leveraging its Git integration and file-based routing. For the back-end, I used Fly, a serverless deployment platform that allowed me to efficiently deploy the RESTful API and automatically scale based on demand. With Fly's deployment, a Dockerfile is created to build a Docker image containing the Node.js application. Build stages handle dependency installation, compilation of Node.js modules, and generating the necessary files. The final stage contains the application ready to run in a Docker container.

flatRentOdyssey.title: 2023: A Flat Rent Odyssey
intro: This is a simple video game that I developed with a teammate, using the JavaScript Canvas technology, as our first project of Ironhack's webDev bootcamp.
You can play using: : ←, →, ↑, a, d

description.subtitle: Technology Used
content: We developed it using the HTML5 <canvas> element, which provides an API for drawing 2D graphics and animations, and JavaScript to implement the game's logic and manipulate the canvas elements.

description.subtitle: Graphic Rendering
content: The game uses the 2D context of the canvas to draw graphic elements such as the background, player, enemies, bullets, and other objects. Functions like fillRect(), fillText(), among others, are used to draw shapes and text on the canvas.

description.subtitle: Animations
content: Animations in the game are achieved by updating and redrawing the canvas at regular time intervals. This can be accomplished using the requestAnimationFrame() function or by using `setInterval()` to call a game update function at a specific frames-per-second (FPS) rate.

description.subtitle: User Interaction
content: User interaction is captured through keyboard events. For example, to move the player, keyboard events like `keydown` and `keyup` are used, and to fire bullets, the letters 'a' and 'd' are used.

description.subtitle: Collisions
content: The game implements collision detection between different elements, such as the player and enemies or bullets and enemies. These collisions are detected through checks of coordinate and size overlap of elements on the canvas.

description.subtitle: Styles and Fonts
content: Attributes like fillStyle, strokeStyle, lineWidth, font, etc., are used to apply different styles, colors, and fonts to the graphic elements on the canvas.

description.subtitle: Optimization
content: To avoid performance issues and excessive memory consumption, the game implements logic to remove elements that are no longer needed, such as bullets that have left the canvas, ensuring smooth and efficient operation.

description.subtitle: Relative Coordinates
content: The application uses relative positions and sizes to place elements on the canvas. This means that coordinates and dimensions are calculated based on the canvas's size, making the game more flexible and adaptable to different screen resolutions.

intro.overview: IGAF is a web-based platform designed to enhance the culinary experience for cooking enthusiasts. It serves as a dynamic recipe hub, offering a vast collection of recipes from various cuisines and dishes.

features.title: Discover and Explore:
features.description: IGAF allows users to explore a wide range of recipes from different culinary traditions.

features.title: Interactive Cooking:
features.description: Unlike conventional recipe websites, IGAF offers an interactive cooking mode. Users can follow recipes with precision, adjust ingredient quantities, and track cooking times.

features.title: Personalized Experience:
features.description: IGAF lets users create profiles, enabling them to save favorite recipes and keep a cooking history.

description.subtitle: Backend Technologies
content: IGAF's backend is powered by a set of technologies that ensure smooth functionality and user interactions.

description.subtitle: Handlebars
content: The backend relies on Handlebars, a templating engine that dynamically generates HTML content. It plays a vital role in creating and rendering dynamic web pages.

description.subtitle: Node.js
content: Node.js serves as the foundation of IGAF's backend. It manages server-side logic, facilitates user authentication, and enables communication between the client and server components of the application.

description.subtitle: Database Management
content: MongoDB, a NoSQL database, is used to efficiently store and retrieve data within IGAF. It is instrumental in managing user profiles, storing recipes, and supporting data-driven functionalities.

overTheYears.title: over the years
text: I recently took a detour in my professional journey, shifting gears from full-stack MERN web development to exploring the exciting realm of DevOps. The trigger? A whirlwind nine-week bootcamp at Ironhack, Madrid. Here, I dove deep into the coding ocean, mastering JavaScript, Node.js, Express, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, MongoDB, and ReactJS.

But that wasn't the end of the ride... I decided to embrace a comprehensive curriculum delving into key DevOps tools and practices. Think Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, Prometheus, and Grafana — all in another intense bootcamp.

My backstory is a patchwork of experiences: armed with a journalism degree, I spent eight dynamic years as a photographer and videographer. From boardrooms to the social third sector, I honed not just technical skills but also creativity, adaptability, a knack for problem-solving, and an eagle eye for detail.
Now, with this diverse skill set in my arsenal, I'm all set to sculpt robust web applications and seamlessly weave in DevOps strategies for a slicker software development journey.
